3.7	
Pad testing
Measurement of urine loss using an absorbent pad worn over a set period of time or during a protocol of 
physical exercise can be used to quantify the presence and severity of UI, as well as provide objective 
evidence of response to treatment.

Adhere to good urodynamic practice standards as described by the International 
Continence Society when performing urodynamics in patients with LUTS.

Do not routinely carry out urodynamics when offering treatment for uncomplicated stress 
urinary incontinence.

Do not routinely carry out urodynamics when offering first-line treatment to patients with 
uncomplicated overactive bladder symptoms.
Perform urodynamics if the findings may change the choice of invasive treatment.

Do not use urethral pressure profilometry or leak point pressure to grade severity of urinary 
incontinence.
